actions.text: Rule provides for consideration of recommittal to conference to H.R. 2712. The conference report shall be considered as having been recommitted to conference. All points of order against consideration of any subsequent conference report on the bill for failure to comply with the provisions of clause 2 of rule XXVIII are waived.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 101-366, by Mr. Frost.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 87.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Providing for the recommittal to conference of the conference report on the bill (H.R. 2712) to facilitate the adjustment or change of status of Chinese nationals in the United States by waiving the 2-year foreign residence requirement for "J" nonimmigrants, and waiving certain points of order against consideration of any subsequent conference report on the bill.

summary.text: Provides for the recommittal to conference of the conference report on H.R. 2712 (Chinese national status) and waives points of order against the consideration of any subsequent report on the bill.

titles.title: Providing for the recommittal to conference of the conference report on the bill (H.R. 2712) to facilitate the adjustment or change of status of Chinese nationals in the United States by waiving the 2-year foreign residence requirement for "J" nonimmigrants, and waiving certain points of order against consideration of any subsequent conference report on the bill.
